fields.name: Usage: /math <inputs>
fields.value: This will calculate the values specified by **inputs** and show the results.

fields.name: Usage: /math <inputs> [hide]
fields.value: Setting the **hide** option to true will cause the result to be only visible to you.

fields.name: X + Y
fields.value: Adds two numbers.

fields.name: X - Y
fields.value: Subtracts two numbers.

fields.name: X * Y
fields.value: Multiplies two numbers.

fields.name: X / Y
fields.value: Divides two numbers.

fields.name: X // Y
fields.value: Divides two numbers and rounds down the result.

fields.name: X % Y
fields.value: Returns the division remainder of two numbers.

fields.name: X ^ Y
fields.value: Takes the power of one number to another.

fields.name: X == Y
fields.value: Returns if the two values are equal.

fields.name: X != Y
fields.value: Returns if the two values are not equal.

fields.name: X < Y
fields.value: Returns if the left number is less than the right number.

fields.name: X > Y
fields.value: Returns if the left number is greater than the right number.

fields.name: X <= Y
fields.value: Returns if the left number is less than or equal to the right number.

fields.name: X <= Y
fields.value: Returns if the left number is greater than or equal to the right number.

fields.name: X && Y
fields.value: Returns if both booleans are true.

fields.name: X || Y
fields.value: Returns if either booleans are true.

fields.name: !X
fields.value: Returns if the boolean is false.

fields.name: (X)
fields.value: Evaluates the values in parentheses first.

fields.name: X ? Y : Z
fields.value: If **X** is true, returns **Y**. Otherwise, return **Z**.

fields.name: X = Y
fields.value: Stores the value of the right side to the variable on the left.

fields.name: true
fields.value: Evaluates to true.

fields.name: false
fields.value: Evaluates to false.

fields.name: XdY
fields.value: Rolls **X** dice with **Y** faces. The drop lowest, drop highest, and unique modifiers are available.

fields.name: XdY[dlN][dhM][u]
fields.value: You are also able to specify the drop lowest, drop highest, or unique modifier to dice rolls. The unique modifier must come last if used.

fields.name: sqrt(X)
fields.value: Returns the square root of a number.

fields.name: ln(X)
fields.value: Returns the natural log of a number.

fields.name: sin(X)
fields.value: Returns the sine of a number.

fields.name: cos(X)
fields.value: Returns the cosine of a number.

fields.name: tan(X)
fields.value: Returns the tangent of a number.

fields.name: floor(X)
fields.value: Rounds down a number.

fields.name: ceil(X)
fields.value: Rounds up a number.

fields.name: trunc(X)
fields.value: Rounds a number towards zero.

fields.name: abs(X)
fields.value: Returns the absolute value of a number.

fields.name: fact(X)
fields.value: Returns the factorial of a number.
